Sentencas: Polarizable interaction potentials, parametrized using ab initio electronic structure calculations, have been used in molecular dynamics simulations to study the conduction mechanism in doped zirconias.
Titulo: Structural Disorder in Doped Zirconias, Part II: Vacancy Ordering Effects and the Conductivity Maximum.

Sentencas: The influence of vacancy-vacancy and vacancy-cation interactions on the conductivity of these materials has been characterized.
Titulo: Structural Disorder in Doped Zirconias, Part II: Vacancy Ordering Effects and the Conductivity Maximum.

Sentencas: Although the latter can be minimized by using dopant Cations with radii which match those of Zr(4+) (as in the case of Sc(3+)), the former appears as an intrinsic characteristic of the fluorite lattice that cannot be avoided and that is shown to be responsible for the occurrence of a maximum in the conductivity at dopant concentrations between 8 and 13%.
Titulo: Structural Disorder in Doped Zirconias, Part II: Vacancy Ordering Effects and the Conductivity Maximum.

Sentencas: The weakness of the Sc-vacancy interactions in Sc(2)O(3)-dope zirconia confirms that this material is likely to present the highest conductivity achievable in zirconias.
Titulo: Structural Disorder in Doped Zirconias, Part II: Vacancy Ordering Effects and the Conductivity Maximum.
